name: Chocolate Peppermint Truffle
description: Dark and decadent with a hint of peppermint, this truffle tart is made with Stevia In The Raw®, so there's less sugar and calories!
recipeIngredient: 5 tablespoons cold butter, cut into cubes
¾ cup Sugar In The Raw®
¾ cup Stevia In The Raw®

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9-inch round springform pan with removable bottom and sides. In the bowl of a food processor, pulse chocolate cookies until fine. Transfer to a bowl and stir in melted butter, Sugar In The Raw and Stevia In The Raw until well combined. Press mixture into bottom and up the sides of pan. Bake crust until firm - about 5 minutes. Remove from oven and cool.

In a medium bowl, add chocolate and butter. In a small saucepan bring cream, Sugar In The Raw, and Stevia In The Raw to a boil whisking constantly until Sugar In The Raw® and Stevia In The Raw® are completely dissolved. Pour cream over the chocolate and butter and whisk until chocolate has melted. Stir in peppermint and pour into crust. Chill at least one hour.
In a large bowl beat cream, Sugar In The Raw®, and Stevia In The Raw® on high speed until stiff peaks form - about 1 minute. Keep refrigerated until ready to serve tart.
Slice tart and top with whipped cream and dust with cocoa powder.

review.reviewBody: This recipe is a keeper! I made some substitutions that allowed me to reduce the sugar even further without affecting taste or texture. Products/Brands Used: I used Nabisco Famous Chocolate Wafers (9 oz pkg) Lily's Extra Dark Stevia Chocolate Bars (4 of their 2.8 oz bars) Domino granulated sugar Stevia in the Raw Land O' Lakes salted butter and Carnation Evaporated Whole Milk (12 oz. can) Crust: Omit the sugar and stevia. Just use the crushed chocolate wafers and butter. Ganache: Reduce the sugar to 1/2 cup and use 3/4 cup Stevia in the Raw. Since I used Lily's Extra Dark Stevia Chocolate instead of unsweetened chocolate I was able to use less sugar. To reduce the fat content I used 1 cup of Carnation evaporated whole milk and reduced the heavy cream to 1/4 cup. To roughly crush the chocolate I beat the chocolate bars with a kitchen mallet while they were still fully wrapped in their packaging.
